title: Taking Out the Common Term
text: First, we must take out $$x^2$$ using the distributive property. We now have $$f(x)=x^2 \left(x^2-1\right)$$
speech: First, we must take out  x squared  using the distributive property. We now have  f of x is equal to x squared, parentheses, x squared minus 1,

using the distributive property. We now have   f of x is equal to x squared, , x squared minus 1,

title: Factoring the Interior Quadratic
text: We can now factor the expression inside the parantheses. $$x^2-1=\left(x+1\right) \left(x-1\right)$$. We now have $$f(x)=x^{2\left(x+1\right)} \left(x-1\right)$$
speech: We can now factor the expression inside the parantheses.  x squared minus 1, is equal to parentheses x plus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 1,  . We now have  f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times, parentheses x plus 1,  power, parentheses x minus 1,
pacedSpeech: We can now factor the expression inside the parantheses.   x squared minus 1, is equal to  x plus 1,  times,  x minus 1,
. We now have   f of x is equal to x raised to the 2 times,  x plus 1,  power,  x minus 1,

title: Solving for the Intercepts
text: We must now set the whole equation $$0$$ and solve for $$x$$. $$0=x^{2\left(x+1\right)} \left(x-1\right)$$. So, $$x=0, 1$$, and $$-1$$. This means our intercepts are $$(0,0),(1,0)$$, and $$(-1,0)$$
